info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 30 at 8:18PM MST until December 31 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM CST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 3 PM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM FRIDAY TO NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Spink and Clark Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM Friday to noon CST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to 3 PM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 3 AM to 6 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
